     <!-- Message in the popup informing the user a dictionary is available for their language, and asking for a decision to download over their mobile data plan or not. Pokud nemáte &lt;b&gt;neomezený datový tarif&lt;/b&gt;, mohou vám být účtovány další poplatky.&lt;br/&gt; Pokud si nejste jisti tím, jaký máte datový tarif, doporučujeme vám vyhledat připojení Wi-Fi, které umožní automatické zahájení stahování.&lt;br/&gt; &lt;br/&gt; Tip: Slovníky můžete v mobilním zařízení stahovat a odebírat pomocí volby &lt;b&gt;Jazyk.</string>

The "Languages & input" part should be set to the actual name of the option (message ID 5292716747264442359 in the translation console). [CHAR_LIMIT=700] -->

     <!-- Message in the popup informing the user a dictionary is available for their language, and asking for a decision to download over their mobile data plan or not. The reason we ask for this is, the data is large and may be downloaded over a paid-per-megabyte connection but a dictionary is also essential to type comfortably, so we ask the user. This only pops in selected cases, when there is no dictionary at all currently, and the only available network seems to be metered. The "Languages & input" part should be set to the actual name of the option (message ID 5292716747264442359 in the translation console). [CHAR_LIMIT=700] -->

     <!-- Message in the popup informing the user a dictionary is available for their language, and asking for a decision to download over their mobile data plan or not. The reason we ask for this is, the data is large and may be downloaded over a paid-per-megabyte connection but a dictionary is also essential to type comfortably, so we ask the user. This only pops in selected cases, when there is no dictionary at all currently, and the only available network seems to be metered. The "Languages & input" part should be set to the actual name of the option (message ID 5292716747264442359 in the translation console). [CHAR_LIMIT=700] -->

     <!-- Message in the popup informing the user a dictionary is available for their language, and asking for a decision to download over their mobile data plan or not. The reason we ask for this is, the data is large and may be downloaded over a paid-per-megabyte connection but a dictionary is also essential to type comfortably, so we ask the user. This only pops in selected cases, when there is no dictionary at all currently, and the only available network seems to be metered. The "Languages & input" part should be set to the actual name of the option (message ID 5292716747264442359 in the translation console). [CHAR_LIMIT=700] -->
     <string name="should_download_over_metered_prompt">Für die auf Ihrem Mobilgerät ausgewählte Sprache ist ein Wörterbuch verfügbar.&lt;br/&gt; Wir empfehlen Ihnen, das Wörterbuch für <xliff:g example="English" id="LANGUAGE_NAME">%1$s</xliff:g> &lt;b&gt;herunterzuladen,&lt;/b&gt; um die Texteingabe zu erleichtern.&lt;br/&gt; &lt;br/&gt; Das Herunterladen kann per 3G 1 bis 2 Minuten dauern. Es können Kosten anfallen, falls Sie nicht über einen &lt;b&gt;Datentarif ohne Begrenzung&lt;/b&gt; verfügen.&lt;br/&gt; Wenn Sie nicht sicher sind, welchen Datentarif Sie nutzen, empfehlen wir Ihnen die Verwendung einer WLAN-Verbindung, um den Download automatisch zu starten.&lt;br/&gt; &lt;br/&gt; Tipp: Sie können Wörterbücher hier herunterladen und entfernen: &lt;b&gt;Sprachen</string>
